caption: A very peculiar place hidden in the woods. The charity running the museum does a great job to make you more familiar with the Russian writer and Pauline Viatdot's patron. The house hosts a collection objects related to the writer and his muse. Take time to talk to the very knowledgeable local guide. Make sure the museum is open the day you want to visit.
museum with a real density of information. You'll have an aperçu of the links between the artists during the middle of the 19th century. High Level
Very attractive house and museum, very evocative
Hiden jevel and important pary of Europes history
A place full of charm and memories. A whole era and an artistic, musical and literary environment. A friendly welcome from the Friends of Turgenev. A preserved and charming site.

Authentic museum with an old atmosphere and not so popular but precious and a little peaceful and outside there is a beautiful green area with trees, flowers and some sculptures, there are also music concerts sometimes, piano music.  Nice details, friendly staff and the entrance of €5 for students and €8 normal ticket to have a good time on Saturdays, to discover and explore cultural places.  Authentic museum with an old atmosphere and not so popular but valuable and a little peaceful and outside there is a beautiful green area with trees, flowers and some sculptures, there are also music concerts, piano.  Nice details, friendly staff and €5 entry for students and €8 normal ticket to have a good time on Saturday, discovering and exploring the cultural places.
Interesting provided you have a guide who retraces the life of Turgenev, his friendship with Pauline Viardot,…
Unfortunately, the house is open very rarely. But the place is very interesting. Makes you think

The Turgenev dacha is closed in winter, but the walk in the park, starting from the Bougival church, is well worth the effort (there are small climbs which, after the rain, are not easy to pass). Beautiful view of the Seine and Rueil. Otherwise, the museum has a small exhibition focused on Pauline Viardo and her family, her sister Maria Malibran. It remains very touching with the samovars etc.
No signage and inaccessible for open days as part of Heritage Days! Who are we kidding?

Very well presented historical place where the great Russian novelist Ivan Turgenev died. An exciting life spent in Europe to be discovered through the windows and objects that belonged to him. The icing on the cake is the love story with Pauline Viardot which leaves us amazed. I highly recommend because during this visit we meet all the great artists of the 19th century.

The charming museum. The association that takes care of the museum is doing its best, but the entire area needs to be restored and cared for. It is a shame that the State does not intervene because it is a legendary place and extremely important for French and Russian heritage.
The dacha is pretty looking from the outside but inside nothing very interesting for me
Magnificent visit to a splendid timeless place. The people are very welcoming and the information very fascinating. I highly recommend.
The entrance is dated, the books on display are old and a little damaged.  Fortunately the museum is very nice. There is a beautiful park but we lack time to admire the house.

Very interesting museum, in a quiet and pleasant area, particularly the museum manager who is passionate and with whom we can talk about Turgenev for a long time and who greatly complements the visit with anecdotes. I recommend the visit.

Thank you for treating so carefully the legacy of the writer, whose stories and novels have been present in the life of the Russian reader since childhood. Thank you also for helping the French discover or simply get to know his work better.
A place full of charm at the end of a splendid avenue of large trees. A warm and personalized welcome from passionate volunteers. An instructive exhibition.
Nice little museum, very little text even in French, let alone other languages.
Very interesting little museum now closed for work in an adjacent building
Always so magical looking at the dacha from Villa Viardot! It is magnificent... but still needs work!
To preserve and restore. Very interesting!  The neighboring Viardot villa will be restored.
Warning: Turgenev's house has been closed since 2020 and the phone indicated by Google continually disturbs a man who is not Turgenev... Sanzot butchery style!
Nice little museum.  Professional and passionate welcome.
A charming place in the middle of the woods, out of time
Very nice museum with a very good commentary
Beautiful moving visit
If you like Turgenev, it's a chance to visit this museum.
Seen from the outside. In the forest. Impressive
You have to read the press pages, some are juicy
We really liked it. I recommend going.
Very documented.  Very rich in documents
The writer's heart beats there
It is closed for renovation
Interesting museum,
Interesting
